DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oral Pain Assessment Visual Analog Scale Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a patient's self-identified oral pain intensity on a 10 point Visual Analog Scale (VAS), in which '0' is no pain and '10' is the worst pain.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of a patient's unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings of the oral cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On a 0 to 10 scale, how PAINF
ReferenceDocuments.description: On a 0 to 10 scale, how PAINFUL is your mouth now? Please circle the number.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR ETIB clinical trial
